Miriam Bhimani 
Dear Miriam: 
RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N013541-040423 
Thank you for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. You requested the following: 
To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records: 

Please supply the full personnel files of the following individuals: 

* Abdul Muhammad, previous Principal at Lindblom HS 
* Antonio Ross, previous Principal at Hyde Park Academy 

This includes any resumes, applications, any job recommendations, promotions, professional license credentials and verification records. Please include a work/salary history. Please include any investigative materials - investigative memorandums, disciplinary actions (suspensions, leaves of absence that stem from disciplinary action), incident reports, EOCO investigations, Office of Civil Rights determinations, non-disciplinary memorandum of understandings, non-union misconduct form, full warning resolutions and any complaints or claims/lawsuits/settlements. Please include any safety plans. 

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Miriam Bhimani 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252Fpersonnel-files-cps-principals-144225%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ1CCn_QB9jem9PQylx6L91s%3A1pjtsY%3AYNs-ESAGk5OE7KWvx4OZv1C5UH-iwwLpToG8x_ZfMpk 
RESPONSE: Documents responsive to your request are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. Please be advised that certain private information (personal descriptions, employee ID numbers, college transcripts, social security numbers, signatures, personal addresses, etc.) was redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7. Specifically, section 7(1)(b) which exempts certain private information as defined by section 2(c-5) and section 7(1)(c) which exempts personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subject of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs any legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a) exempts “ information specifically prohibited from disclosure by federal or State Law … ” (5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a)) Specifically, 105 ILCS 5/10-21.9 (b) states that “ any information concerning the record of convictions obtained by the president of the school board or the regional superintendent shall be confidential and may only be transmitted to the superintendent of the school district or his designee, the appropriate regional superintendent if the check was requested by the school district, the presidents of the appropriate school boards if the check was requested from the Department of State Police by the regional superintendent, the State Superintendent of Education, the State Teacher Certification Board, any other person necessary to the decision of hiring the applicant for employment, or for clarification purposes the Department of State Police or Statewide Sex Offender Database, or both.” 
Portions of this request that include personnel evaluations are redacted entirely in accordance with section 7(1)(a) of FOIA (5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a)) which exempts from public release information specifically prohibited from disclosure by federal or State law or rules and regulations implementing federal or State law and also in accordance with section 7.5(q) of the FOIA (5 ILCS 140/7.5(q)) which exempts from public release information prohibited from being disclosed by the Personnel Records Review Act [820 ILCS 40/0.01 et seq.] Section 7.5(h) exempts from disclosure “information the disclosure of which is exempted under the State Officials and Employees Ethics Act, and records of any lawfully created State or local inspector general’s office that would be exempt if created or obtained by an Executive Inspector General’s office.” 5 ILCS 140/7.5(h). 
Certain records are being withheld entirely pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(f) as factual information inextricably intertwined in ongoing investigation and processes as well as 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(n), which exempts from release records relating to the adjudication of employee discipline and grievance matters except for records reflecting the final outcome. Records of discipline more than four years old are exempt from disclosure pursuant to section 7.5(q) of the FOIA (5 ILCS 140/7.5(q)), which exempts information prohibited from being disclosed by the Personnel Records Review Act [820 ILCS 40/0.01 et seq.]. 820 ILCS 40/8 of the Personnel Records Review Act states that “an employer shall review a personnel record before releasing information to a third party and, except when the release is ordered to a party in a legal action or arbitration, delete disciplinary reports, letters of reprimand, or other records of disciplinary action which are more than 4 years old.” 
Redactions have been made pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7.5 (r), which exempts from inspection or copying information prohibited from being disclosed by the Illinois School Student Records Act (ISSRA). ISSRA prohibits the disclosure of students and any student records in which a student may be individually identified by a school regardless of how or where the information pursuant to (105 ILCS 10/2(d). Redactions have also been made in accordance with 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(j)(iii) which exempts from release information concerning a school or university’s adjudication of student disciplinary cases, but only to the extent that disclosure would unavoidably reveal the identity of the student. 
You have a right to have the denial of your request reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). You can file your Request for Review with the PAC by writing to: 
Public Access Counselor Office of the Attorney General 500 South 2nd Street Springfield, Illinois 62706 Fax: 217-782-1396 E-mail: publicaccess@atg.state.il.us You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court. 5 ILCS 140/11. If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this denial letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this denial letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. Sincerely, 
Patricia Majchrowicz FOIA Officer Chicago Public Schools

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: ICPT
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Records of Insterstate Compact on the Placement of Children requests received by OCFS since 2015
Records detailing the average length of time between a request for a home study per the Compact and the study's completion since 2015

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sam Mellins

title: Inspector General closed cases 2014 (Department of Homeland Security Office of Inspector General)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Inspector General closed cases 2014 (Department of Homeland Security Office of Inspector General)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

a copy of the list or printout or database listing of Inspector General investigations closed/reports completed during calendar year 2014. If the list is organized by FY rather than calendar year, the FY 2014 list is sufficient for this request. If no central list or database exists, then I request copies of the cover sheet or first page of each IG report completed during calendar year 2014.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

Fax Number:
Are you requesting records on yourself?  No
If yes, you must check the perjury statement:
By initialing here you are providing your electronic signature.:
Please describe the records you are seeking as clearly and precisely as
possible:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following
records:

a copy of the list or printout or database listing of Inspector General
investigations closed/reports completed during calendar year 2014. If the
list is organized by FY rather than calendar year, the FY 2014 list is
sufficient for this request. If no central list or database exists, then I
request copies of the cover sheet or first page of each IG report completed
during calendar year 2014.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me
of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the
request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if
not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look
forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days,
as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

Attachments:

https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/EmmaBest/74507/Fee20category20and20search20parameters.pdf
Upload documents directly:
https://https://www.muckrock.comhttps://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?url_auth_token=AAAegebJAsxcsZiw371aNOfPOBM%3A1iUjiT%3AkmjyidK05vPmLcX6V3gd3wM975o&next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fdepartment-of-homeland-security-office-of-inspector-general-236%252Finspector-general-closed-cases-2014-department-of-homeland-security-office-of-inspector-general-83090%252F%253Femail%253DFOIA.OIG%252540oig.dhs.gov
I am willing to pay fees for this request up to the amount of: $: 25
Select from the list below:  A representative of the news media seeking
information as part of a news gathering effort and not for commercial use.
I request a waiver of all fees for this request.:  I request a waiver of all
fees for this request.
Please provide an explanation for your request for a fee waiver:
I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have
previously
written about the government and its activities, with some reaching over
100,000
readers in outlets such as Gizmodo, MuckRock, Motherboard, Property of the
People,
Unicorn Riot, and The Outline, among others. As such, as I have a reasonable
expectation of publication and my editorial and writing skills are well
established. In
addition, I discuss and comment on the files online and make them available
through
non-profits such as the library Internet Archive and the journalist
non-profit MuckRock,
disseminating them to a large audience. While my research is not limited to
this, a great
deal of it, including this, focuses on the activities and attitudes of the
government itself.
As such, it is not necessary for me to demonstrate the relevance of this
particular
subject in advance.
Further, case law states that “proof of the ability to disseminate the
released information
to a broad cross- section of the public is not required.” Judicial Watch,
Inc. v. Dep’t of
Justice, 365 F.3d 1108, 1126 (D.C. Cir. 2004); see Carney v. U.S. Dep’t of
Justice, 19 F.
3d 807, 814-15 (2d Cir. 1994). Further, courts have held that "qualified
because it also
had “firm” plans to “publish a number of . . . ‘document sets’”
concerning United States
foreign and national security policy." Under this criteria, as well, I
qualify as a member of
the news media.
Additionally, courts have held that the news media status "focuses on the
nature of the
requester, not its request. The provision requires that the request be
“made by” a
representative of the news media. Id. § 552(a)(4)(A)(ii)(II). A newspaper
reporter, for
example, is a representative of the news media regardless of how much
interest there is
in the story for which he or she is requesting information." As such, the
details of the
request itself are moot for the purposes of determining the appropriate fee
category.
As my primary purpose is to inform about government activities by reporting
on it and
making the raw data available, I request that fees be waived.
Please select and describe in detail if you believe your request warrants
expeditious handling:
Please provide information to support your selection:

communications.subject: Still Interested FOIA 2020-IGFO-00027
communications.communication:
Emma Best,                                                                                                                                      Date:  December 8, 2022

The Department of Homeland Security (DHS), Office of Inspector General (OIG) is currently working on our backlog of FOIAs. As we reach the older requests in our queue for processing, we have found that many requesters are no longer interested in the requested material.

Please indicate Yes or No your continued interest in pursuing these records within 30 calendar days from the date of this email.

Because the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) is currently in a telework status due to the outbreak of COVID-19 you may notify us in writing via email at foia.oig@oig.dhs.gov<mailto:foia.oig@oig.dhs.gov>.  If we do not receive a response within 30 days, we will assume you are no longer interested in this FOIA request and will administratively close this case.

Should you have any questions about this response, please contact us via email at foia.oig@oig.dhs.gov<mailto:foia.oig@oig.dhs.gov>.

Sincerely,

DHS-OIG FOIA Team

communications.subject: Status Inquiry FOIA 2020-IGFO-00027
communications.communication:
Emma Best,

The Department of Homeland Security (DHS), Office of Inspector General (OIG) is processing both current and backlog FOIAs.  We estimate FOIA 2020-IGFO-00027 will be processed and completed around April 28, 2023.  This date is only an estimated timeframe for completion.  FOIA 2020-IGFO-00027 may be completed before or after this date.  We ask for your patience as DHS-OIG continues to work to reduce/eliminate the backlog, while also working on current FOIAs.  Thank you for the submission of status inquiry for FOIA 2020-IGFO-00027.

Sincerely,

DHS-OIG FOIA Team

If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@ic.fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI's FOIPA Program is searching the FBI's indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 134 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 523 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,335 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 1,875 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
Record/Information Dissemination Section (RIDS) FBI-Information Management Division
170 Marcel Drive, Winchester, VA 22602-4843
Direct: (540) 868-4593
Fax: (540) 868-4391
Questions E-mail: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

title: FOIL Request for Records Related to Communications with American Academy of Pediatrics and Council on School Health (Voorheesville Central School District)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: FOIL Request for Records Related to Communications with American Academy of Pediatrics and Council on School Health (Voorheesville Central School District)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am seeking all records related to the American Academy of Pediatrics (AAP) and the Council on School Health (COSH), including any communications or correspondence between the school district and these organizations, or any other party that may have provided information to the district from these organizations.

To help identify responsive records, you can limit your time period to 1/1/2017 until the date of final response; also I request that you search for the following terms, which are focused on the American Academy of Pediatrics and its affiliated organizations:

"American Academy of Pediatrics"
"AAP"
"Council on School Health"
"COSH"
"pediatric"
"child health"
"school health"

Please include records of any type, including but not limited to emails, letters, memoranda, reports, meeting minutes, presentations, and any other records of communication or correspondence between the American Academy of Pediatrics, the Council on School Health, and the school district or any other party that may have provided information to the district from these organizations.

If no records are responsive to this request, please provide a certification of that fact pursuant to Public Officers Law §89(3), and inform me of the district's obligations under LGS-01 to retain records until any appeal has been resolved.

If any records are withheld, please provide an explanation of the legal basis for the withholding.

If my request is denied in whole or in part, please provide a written explanation of the reasons for the denial.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

title: Rhode Island State Employees (2019 - 2022)

communications.subject: Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act Request: Rhode Island State Employees (2019 - 2022)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Monthly electronic listings of all employees of the Rhode Island Executive Branch from January 1, 2019 to July 31, 2022. Specifically, I am seeking electronic listings of all individuals employed within all state agencies, commissions, and departments for each month from January 1, 2019 to July 31, 2022.

For each month, I’m seeking a spreadsheet, database, or delimited text file(s) — not paper records or a PDF created from data — with the following fields for each employee: full legal name, unique employee identification code, date of birth or age, title, job title code, department or agency, race, gender, full-time/part-time status, location, hire date, termination date, civil service or classification status, and gross annual salary. If you cannot produce any of these fields, please let me know and generate only the available variables.

If these data are not available at monthly intervals, please produce the datasets at the most frequent interval possible. For example, if the data is not available monthly, please produce the data at quarterly intervals.

In addition, please include any lookup tables that may be needed to interpret the data. For example, if departments are listed with codes linked to a separate table, I will be happy to join the records myself, rather than require your staff to do so.

I see that RI makes many of these data available here: http://www.transparency.ri.gov/payroll/. If my request above cannot be filled, I would like to request at minimum a copy of the data available on the transparency site with a variable that denotes whether an employee is in the classified, unclassified, or non-classified service. 

I am comfortable working with large data sets and can receive the records in a variety of formats (.dbf, .csv, .mdb, etc).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Goehring

communications.subject: Your first record request #23-69 has been opened.
communications.communication:
RI Department of Administration ************************************************************************ Your first RI Department of Administration record request (request number #23-69) has been submitted. It is currently unpublished and is not available for the general public to view. Thank you for your submission. The Department of Administration ("Department") has received your Access to Public Records Act ("APRA") request. The Department will respond formally to your request on or before ten (10) business days from the receipt of your request in accordance with APRA and the Department's APRA regulations, available at https://rules.sos.ri.gov/regulations/part/220-50-05-1. Please note that requests received after business hours are considered received the following business day. Additionally, please note that for voluminous or time-consuming requests or for other good cause, the Department may extend the time to respond for an additional twenty (20) business days and/or may estimate and request prepayment of search and retrieval charges ($15 per hour with the first hour free) before proceeding with the request. Thank you. As the requester, you can always see the status of your request by signing into the RI Department of Administration Public Records portal here. If you haven't already activated your account, click here to get started. Once your account is activated, your request will be visible at the following link: Request #23-69. ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at RI Department of Administration.

Technical support: See our help page

communications.subject: [External Message Added] RI Department of Administration public records request #23-69
communications.communication:
RI Department of Administration ************************************************************************ A message was sent to you regarding record request #23-69: Dear Requestor: The Rhode Island Department of Administration (“Department”) is responding to your public records request for the following: Monthly electronic listings of all employees of the Rhode Island Executive Branch from January 1, 2019 to July 31, 2022. Specifically, I am seeking electronic listings of all individuals employed within all state agencies, commissions, and departments for each month from January 1, 2019 to July 31, 2022. For each month, I’m seeking a spreadsheet, database, or delimited text file(s) — not paper records or a PDF created from data — with the following fields for each employee: full legal name, unique employee identification code, date of birth or age, title, job title code, department or agency, race, gender, full-time/part-time status, location, hire date, termination date, civil service or classification status, and gross annual salary. If you cannot produce any of these fields, please let me know and generate only the available variables.   If these data are not available at monthly intervals, please produce the datasets at the most frequent interval possible. For example, if the data is not available monthly, please produce the data at quarterly intervals.   In addition, please include any lookup tables that may be needed to interpret the data. For example, if departments are listed with codes linked to a separate table, I will be happy to join the records myself, rather than require your staff to do so.   I see that RI makes many of these data available here: http://www.transparency.ri.gov/payroll/. If my request above cannot be filled, I would like to request at minimum a copy of the data available on the transparency site with a variable that denotes whether an employee is in the classified, unclassified, or non-classified service. Your request is governed by the Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act (“APRA”) contained in R.I. Gen. Laws § 38-2-1 et seq. This response is solely on behalf of the Department and not any other agency or branch of government.  With respect to age, race, gender of specific individuals, this information is exempt from disclosure. Pursuant to R.I. Gen. Laws § 38-2-2(4)(A)(I)(b), the age, race and gender of specific state employees are not expressly defined as “public” in APRA. Therefore, in accordance with this statutory provision, the Department must determine whether disclosing this employee information tied to specific individuals “would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy.” After consideration and balancing the interests of government transparency, the Department believes that disclosing the self-identified race, age and gender of a specific, individually named employees would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy and these individuals may not want this information disclosed for personal reasons. Furthermore, disclosing this information tied to specific individuals could place these individuals at risk of identity theft and phishing attacks. Thus, the information is exempt from disclosure. However, in the interests of transparency, with this response, the Department is providing aggregate, de-identified information with respect to race, ethnicity, and gender for each agency.  In order to go back in time and create a monthly report based on past information, the Department estimates it will take approximately 4 hours for every month to pull tape and recreate the list of employees at that point in time. Therefore, based on 42 months, it will take 168 hours at a rate of $15.00 per hour making a total of $2505.00. (Note: The first hour of search and retrieval in response to an APRA request is free, and the Department may charge $15.00 per hour thereafter.) Alternatively, If the Department runs the report quarterly, it will be 14 quarters at 4 hours for each quarter for a total of $825.00. (Note: The first hour of search and retrieval in response to an APRA request is free, and the Department may charge $15.00 per hour thereafter.) Finally, without going back in time, the Department is able to provide a spreadsheet of current employees with the following columns name, title, department, annual salary, classified/unclassified/non-classified status at no charge.  In accordance with R.I. Gen. Laws § 38-2-4(b) and 220-RICR-50-05-1.6(B) of the Department’s APRA Regulations, the first hour of search and retrieval in response to an APRA request is free, and the Department may charge $15.00 per hour thereafter. The Department has provided estimates for both monthly and quarterly reports. Therefore, the estimated cost must be prepaid before the Department proceeds with your request as follows: Please make check or money order for prepayment payable to “Rhode Island General Fund” and send or deliver the payment to the attention of Division of Legal Services, One Capitol Hill, 4th Floor, Providence, RI 02908, with specific reference to your request. Please note time will be tolled under APRA until payment is made. Additionally, without waiving any exemptions under APRA, once payment is received, the Department would require additional time (up to 20 additional business days) in accordance with § 38-2-3(e), to complete the above-mentioned reports. Otherwise, please indicate whether you wish only to receive a report with current employees. If we do not hear from you regarding prepayment after 30 days, we will consider this request closed, but you may resubmit at any time. If you would like to appeal any portion of this response, you may do so in accordance with the provisions of R.I. Gen. Laws § 38-2-8 to the Chief Administrative Officer at the Department (Director, Department of Administration, One Capitol Hill, 4th Floor, Providence, Rhode Island 02908), to the Rhode Island Attorney General, or in the Superior Court through judicial action.  Thank you.  ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at RI Department of Administration.

title: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST – PREDICTIVE  SOFTWARE (Sacramento Police Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST – PREDICTIVE  SOFTWARE (Sacramento Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request the following information from your office for the period January 1, 2020 to the date of this letter.

 - Number, if any, of Predictive Algorithimic software packages or service agreements designed to anticipate criminal actitivites in place with this department or agency. Please specify if software has been purchased or if services are performed by outside contractors for the department or agency.

 - Any documents or correspondence during the period encompassing this request regarding possible or planned acquisition of  Predictive Algorithimic software packages or service agreements.

 - Any existing or proposed usage policies regarding the use of Predictive Algorithimic software packages or service agreements. including protocols, training documents, data storage procedures and prohibited activities.

 - Any current or past litigation involving or referencing this department or agency involving the use of Predictive Algorithimic Software Packages or Service Contractors.

Please notify me when this information is available.

Thank you for your attention to this request and for your prompt reply within 10 days.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aaron Swartz Day Police Surveillance Project

title: FOIL: Enrollment Projection Source Data including Live Birth Data and Communications (Locust Valley Central School District)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: FOIL: Enrollment Projection Source Data including Live Birth Data and Communications (Locust Valley Central School District)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Live Birth Data including constant birth rate, long term, short term and average birth rates for within the district for current and previous 6 years.

Birth to Kindergarten Survival Ratio used for the past 10 years by year.

Projected Kindergarten Enrollment for the past 10 years by year, and supporting data.

Any communications with NYS DOH or County DOH or other data service provider requesting, receiving or inquiring regarding live birth data, birth to kindergarten survival rate or other statistical data used for projecting enrollment.

Copies of all enrollment projections for the past 6 years and source statistical data, including but not limited to live birth data which were used to provide projected enrollment data upon which securities purchasers rely.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: FOIL: Enrollment Projection Source Data including Live Birth Data and Communications (Locust Valley Central School District)
communications.communication:
I hope this message finds you well. I am writing in response to your determination on April 11, 2023, stating that the Locust Valley Central School District does not maintain or possess the records I requested in my Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) request dated March 5, 2023.

Based on the disclosure documents published on the Municipal Securities Rulemaking Board's Electronic Municipal Market Access (EMMA) website, it appears that the District does, in fact, produce enrollment projections and attests to these projections in multiple instances. Specifically, on page A-2 (page 20 in the PDF) of the document found at the following link: https://emma.msrb.org/P11520405.pdf

Given this information, I kindly request that you reconsider and reevaluate my original FOIL request for the following records:

1. Live Birth Data including constant birth rate, long term, short term, and average birth rates for within the district for the current and previous six years.
2. Birth to Kindergarten Survival Ratio used for the past ten years by year.
3. Projected Kindergarten Enrollment for the past ten years by year, and supporting data.
4. Any communications with NYS DOH or County DOH or other data service provider requesting, receiving, or inquiring regarding live birth data, birth to kindergarten survival rate, or other statistical data used for projecting enrollment.
5. Copies of all enrollment projections for the past six years and source statistical data, including but not limited to live birth data which were used to provide projected enrollment data upon which securities purchasers rely.

If the District does not maintain these specific records, I kindly request that you provide any alternative records or information that may help fulfill my request, such as the departments or agencies that might maintain such records.

The email is in response to your attached FOIL follow-up in regards to the
reconsideration of the April 11th determination of your original FOIL
request to Locust Valley CSD.  See the District's response below.

1. Live Birth Data including constant birth rate, long term, short term,
and average birth rates for within the district for the current and
previous six years. *The District does not maintain or possess the records
requested.*
2. Birth to Kindergarten Survival Ratio used for the past ten years by
year.  *The District does not maintain or possess the records requested.*
3. Projected Kindergarten Enrollment for the past ten years by year, and
supporting data.  * See attached ST-3 filing.*
4. Any communications with NYS DOH or County DOH or other data service
provider requesting, receiving, or inquiring regarding live birth data,
birth to kindergarten survival rate, or other statistical data used for
projecting enrollment.  *The District does not maintain or possess the
records requested.*
5. Copies of all enrollment projections for the past six years and source
statistical data, including but not limited to live birth data which were
used to provide projected enrollment data upon which securities purchasers
rely.
* See attached ST-3 filing.*

Please confirm receipt.

Regards,
Karen

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Bellevue School District – Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including District Responses for the years 2015 - 2021
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the Bellevue School District and a complete electronic copy of the District's Responses to these Public Records Requests for the time period January 1, 2010 through November 4, 2021.

In the event the District chooses to provide these records in installments over time I request the records to be produced in reverse chronological order - from the most recent records to the earliest.

If this request is denied in whole or part, I ask that you justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions of the PRA. I also request a detailed contemporaneous log to be provided for any document withheld or redacted.

For each responsive record the District contends is exempt from public disclosure, in whole or in part, please specifically identify the record by subject, title, author, custodian and date, and state how a specific statutory exemption applies to each record as required by RCW 42.56.210(3) and Rental Housing Ass'n v. Des Moines, 165 Wn.2d 525, 199 P.3d 393 (2009).

I request electronic production of all electronic records in the original NATIVE electronic format for each record. 

I request for these public records to be produced by public (no password) e-mail attachment or link. If electronic attachment or link is not possible, an alternative would be to produce responsive records via USB DRIVE or DATA CD-ROM.

THIS REQUEST IS NOT BEING MADE FOR COMMERCIAL PURPOSES.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

PRA Audit

communications.subject: PRR 11032021-Anon, Requests received by the District including District Responses for the years 2015 - 2021
communications.communication:
PRR 11032021-Anon (Please refer to this number in all correspondence about your request)
Dear Anonymous requestor:
On behalf of the Bellevue School District, I am responding to your request for records described as follows:

I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the Bellevue School District and a complete electronic copy of the District's Responses to these Public Records Requests for the time period January 1, 2010 through November 4, 2021.
Clarification Question:

  1.  In the subject line of your message, you state a date range of "2015-2021." In the body of your message you state a date range of "January 1, 2010 through November 4, 2021." What date range do you intend? Please note that your request was made and received on November 3, 2021.


Your answer to this question is due on December 10, 2021. Additional clarification questions may arise in the course of completing your request.

Estimated Timing of Response
Your request may be completed in a series of installments. I estimate a first installment on January 14, 2021 based on a number of factors, including but not limited to the present workload in this office, staff absences, and holiday office closures. Estimates are subject to adjustment.
Best regards,

Helen A. Boyer
Public Records Officer
Bellevue School District No. 405
425-456-4101

communications.communication:
Hello,

This public records request was filed on 11-03-2021. It is now 07-07-2022. As of today's date The District has only produced a total of 3 files - a Public Records Request log from 2018 (15 Pages) and a Public Records Request log from 2017 part 1 (10 Pages) and part 2 (16 pages). 

PLEASE NOTE OUR ORIGINIALPRA REQUEST:

"I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the Bellevue School District and a complete electronic copy of the District's Responses to these Public Records Requests for the time period January 1, 2010 through November 4, 2021.In the event the District chooses to provide these records in installments over time I request the records to be produced in reverse chronological order - from the most recent records to the earliest."

When can we expect a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the Bellevue School District?

When can we expect a complete electronic copy of the District's Responses to these Public Records Requests for the time period January 1, 2010 through November 4, 2021?

When can we expect all of these records to be produced  in reverse chronological order - from the most recent records to the earliest?

Thank you.

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Bellevue School District – Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including District Responses for the years 2015 - 2021
communications.communication:
PRR 11032021-Anon
Dear Requestor:
Please include in the above request number in all of your correspondence with this office.
Your request is:

I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the Bellevue School District and a complete electronic copy of the District's Responses to these Public Records Requests for the time period January 1, 2010 through November 4, 2021.
Thank you for making your July 7 status inquiry, which will inform the District’s next installment to your request, presently estimated for July 20, 2022.
We may have a misunderstanding as to what records you intend to request. I have been producing, on behalf of the District, public records request logs, which are “electronic cop[ies]” of “Public Records Requests received by the Bellevue School District.” I understood the logs to be directly responsive to the first part of your request.

Clarification Questions

  1.  If you do not believe public records request logs are responsive to your request, please clarify your request to explain what records you intended to request by seeking “a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the Bellevue School District.”
  2.  As you likely know, Washington law does not require agencies to retain records relating to public requests records beyond two years after the request is closed. The Local Government Common Records Retention Schedule, section 5.4, sets forth records that may be destroyed after two years, which “[i]ncludes but is not limited to:”

“Internal and external correspondence relating to the request;”

“Records documenting the public records provided to the requestor (copies or lists of the records provided, etc.);” and

“Records documenting the public records (or portions) withheld (exemption logs, copies of portions redacted, etc.).”

Thus, many such records relating to requests closed more than 2 years prior to the date of your request no longer exist. That is also why I was producing request logs to you. For many of the older requests, the request logs may be the only existing records. Do you no longer want to receive request logs, even if they may be the only existing records potentially responsive to your request with respect to requests closed more than two years prior to the date of your request?

  1.  I was also producing request logs to give you an opportunity to identify particular requests that were of interest to you, so searches for records relating to those requests could be prioritized. Is that an opportunity that is of interest to you?

Your answers to these clarification questions are due within 30 days, that is, on or before August 12. The timing of your answers will affect the timing of the District’s next response. The District will not proceed with the next installment scheduled for July 20, pending receipt of your answers, so that the District’s responses can reflect an accurate understanding of what you are requesting. If you do not answer within 30 days, your request may be closed.

The District is under no obligation to produce records to you in a reverse chronological order. Records will be produced in a manner that reflects the most efficient method of assembling and reviewing potentially responsive records.

I look forward to hearing from you.
Best regards,

Helen A. Boyer
Public Records Officer
Bellevue School District No. 405
425-456-4101
publicrecords@bsd405.org<mailto:publicrecords@bsd405.org>

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #11032021-Anon
communications.communication:
ANSWERS TO YOUR QUESTIONS:

Clarification Questions

1. If you do not believe public records request logs are responsive to your request, please clarify your request to explain what records you intended to request by seeking “a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the Bellevue School District.”

ANSWER: 

PRODUCE A COPY (NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT PREFERRED) OF ALL PUBLIC RECORDS REQUESTS RECEIVED BY THE BELLEVUE SCHOOL DISTRICT FOR THE TIME PERIOD JANUARY 1, 2010 THROUGH NOVEMBER 4, 2021.

PRODUCE A COPY (NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT PREFERRED) OF EACH RESPONSE TO ALL PUBLIC RECORDS REQUESTS RECEIVED BY THE BELLEVUE SCHOOL DISTRICT FOR THE TIME PERIOD JANUARY 1, 2010 THROUGH NOVEMBER 4, 2021.

2. As you likely know, Washington law does not require agencies to retain records relating to public requests records beyond two years after the request is closed. The Local Government Common Records Retention Schedule, section 5.4, sets forth records that may be destroyed after two years, which “[i]ncludes but is not limited to:”

“Internal and external correspondence relating to the request;”

“Records documenting the public records provided to the requestor (copies or lists of the records provided, etc.);” and

“Records documenting the public records (or portions) withheld (exemption logs, copies of portions redacted, etc.).”

Thus, many such records relating to requests closed more than 2 years prior to the date of your request no longer exist. That is also why I was producing request logs to you. For many of the older requests, the request logs may be the only existing records. Do you no longer want to receive request logs, even if they may be the only existing records potentially responsive to your request with respect to requests closed more than two years prior to the date of your request?

1. I was also producing request logs to give you an opportunity to identify particular requests that were of interest to you, so searches for records relating to those requests could be prioritized. Is that an opportunity that is of interest to you?

ANSWER: 

REQUEST THAT YOU WORK AS DIRECTED AND PRODUCE ALL RESPONSIVE RECORDS REQUESTED. 
THE LOGS ARE RESPONSIVE RECORDS AND SHOULD BE PRODUCED. 
ALL PUBLIC RECORDS REQUESTS AND RESPONSES RETAINED BY THE DISTRICT SHOULD BE PRODUCED.
 A COMPLETE SEARCH FOR ALL RESPONSIVE RECORDS SHOULD HAVE ALREADY BEEN CONDUCTED BY THE DISTRICT.
AT A MINIMUM ALL RECORDS FROM 2020 AND 2021 SHOULD HAVE ALREADY BEEN PRODUCED IN REVERSE CHRONOLOGICAL FORMAT.

QUESTION: HAS THE DISTRICT CONDUCTED A COMPLETE SEARCH FOR ALL RESPONSIVE RECORDS REQUESTED INCLUDING INCLUDE A SEARCH OF ALL COMPUTERS AND DIGITAL STORAGE DEVICES OWNED, OPERATED, OR CONTROLLED BY DISTRICT EMPLOYEES?

IF SO, PLEASE LIST ALL LOCATIONS SEARCHED BY THE DISTRICT IN DETAIL. 

PLEASE DISCONTINUE ANY AND ALL PERSONAL SOLICITATIONS AND PERSONAL INQUIRIES INCLUDING YOUR MOST RECENT REGARDING PROVIDING UNSOLICITED OPPORTUNITIES OF INTEREST.

Thank you.

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #11032021-Anon, Installment 4
communications.communication:
PRR 11032021-Anon-Muckrock
Dear Requestor:
On behalf of the Bellevue School District, I am making a fourth installment to your request as follows:

I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the Bellevue School District and a complete electronic copy of the District's Responses to these Public Records Requests for the time period January 1, 2010 through November 4, 2021.
You indicated in your July 14, 2022 response to clarifying questions below that you agree that public record request logs are responsive to your request. Therefore, appended hereto please find:

2019 Log

This record contains information that is exempt under the Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56.RCW. Redactions made pursuant to the Act are marked with an overlying code. I have also attached a Redaction and Exemption Codes chart that provides an explanation of the basis for the exemptions applied. If no code is applied or if a code is partially visible, the applicable codes are 1A, 10A.

I regret that it was not possible to make an installment of records to you on the previously estimated date of August 3, 2022. The factors affecting the extension of that date included staff absences due to illness and vacation break, and ongoing workload in this department.
As I indicated to you in response to your request PRR 11022021-Anon, the District is not withholding any records from you and has nothing to hide.
Please direct all messages pertaining to your request to the public records mailbox, publicrecords@bsd405.org<mailto:publicrecords@bsd405.org>.
The automated correspondence features of the Muckrock site are not an efficient way to correspond or to review correspondence. Please do not interrupt our correspondence history by cutting messages out of the email string, or by excerpting them in any way. I know that the correspondence history can get long. However, it is important in order for us to communicate effectively that a complete and accurate history of our communications is readily available to both of us.
I estimate a next installment to your request will be made on or before September 26, 2022. Estimated dates are subject to change. The timing of this estimate is based on anticipated staff absences, operational responsibilities related to school reopening, and the workload in this department.
Best regards,

Helen A. Boyer
Public Records Officer
Bellevue School District No. 405
425-456-4101
publicrecords@bsd405.org<mailto:publicrecords@bsd405.org>

Dear Requestor:

Attached please find our ninth production installment in response to your November 3, 2021 request for records. This production contains responsive records (request and productions) for the following 2020 public record requests:

Best,
Sarah

title: Masked LEOs (Metropolitan Police Department)

communications.subject: DC Freedom of Information Act Request: Masked LEOs (Metropolitan Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the DC Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Policies, including implementation, termination and expiration notices, mentioning or discussing mask mandates or requirements for employees.

2. Reports regarding alleged violations of or non-compliance with mask mandates or requirements.

3. Records documenting any disciplinary actions taken regarding Item #2.

4. Emails, letters, memos and other written or memorialized discussions with unions or employee representatives regarding actual or proposed mask mandates or requirements (such as those requested in Item #1).

I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have previously written about the government and its activities, with some reaching over 100,000 readers in outlets such as Gizmodo, MuckRock, Motherboard, Property of the People, Unicorn Riot, and The Outline, among others. As such, as I have a reasonable expectation of publication and my editorial and writing skills are well established. In addition, I discuss and comment on the files online and make them available through non-profits such as the library Internet Archive and the journalist non-profit MuckRock, disseminating them to a large audience. While my research is not limited to this, a great deal of it, including this, focuses on the activities and attitudes of the government itself. As such, it is not necessary for me to demonstrate the relevance of this particular subject in advance.

As my primary purpose is to inform about government activities by reporting on it and making the raw data available, I request that fees be waived.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma North-Best

communications.subject: Acknowledgement Letter 2021-FOIA-08043
communications.communication: DearMs./Mrs. North-Best, TheFreedom of Information Act (FOIA) requires that requests describe the recordssought with sufficient detail to allow an agency employee familiar with thesubject area of the request to locate the records with a reasonable amount ofeffort.  More specifically, 1 DCMR § 402.4 states that: A request shallreasonably describe the desired record(s). Please provide a timeframe for therecords you are seeking. Yourrequest does not adequately describe the records sought; therefore, we areunable to process it at this time.  If you wish to pursue your request, pleaseprovide a timeframe for the records you areseeking to enable our office to process your request. If we do not receive the clarificationrequired within five (5) business days from the date of thisletter, we will presume that you are no longer interested in pursuing yourrequest and consider this a constructive withdrawal and close our file. In the meantime, your request will be placed on hold and the time for ourresponse will not accrue under 1 DMCR § 405.6. Regards, LatrinaCrumlin StaffAssistant, FOIA MetropolitanPolice Department 300Indiana Avenue, Rm 4153 Washington,DC  20001

title: Maine State Employees (2018 - 2022)

communications.subject: Maine Freedom of Access Act Request: Maine State Employees (2018 - 2022)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maine Freedom of Access Act, I hereby request the following records:

Monthly electronic listings of all employees of the Maine Executive Branch from January 1, 2018 to July 31, 2022. Specifically, I am seeking electronic listings of all individuals employed within all state agencies, commissions, and departments for each month from January 1, 2018 to July 31, 2022.

For each month, I’m seeking a spreadsheet, database, or delimited text file(s) — not paper records or a PDF created from data — with the following fields for each employee: full legal name, unique employee identification code, date of birth or age, title, department or agency, race, gender, full-time/part-time status, location, hire date, termination date, civil service status, and gross annual salary. If you cannot produce any of these fields, please let me know and generate only the available variables.

If these data are not available at monthly intervals, please produce the datasets at the most frequent interval possible. For example, if the data is not available monthly, please produce the data at quarterly intervals.

In addition, please include any lookup tables that may be needed to interpret the data. For example, if departments are listed with codes linked to a separate table, I will be happy to join the records myself, rather than require your staff to do so.

I am comfortable working with large data sets and can receive the records in a variety of formats (.dbf, .csv, .mdb, etc).

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by 1 M.R.S.A. § 408(6). The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Goehring

communications.subject: RE: Maine Freedom of Access Act Request: Maine State Employees (2018 - 2022)
communications.communication:
Hello,
This email is in response to a request seeking information pursuant to the Maine Freedom of Access Act.

The Department of Administrative and Financial Services (DAFS ) acknowledges your request, while simultaneously reserving the right to withhold, in part or in full, documents that are protected from disclosure by rule or statute.  Once we complete our review of the requested material, DAFS will provide you with an estimate of the time necessary to complete the process of responding to your request.  We may also require the payment of costs as authorized by law.

DAFS will notify you, within a reasonable time, of a date and time for review and copying of the documents (or by transmitting copies to you) not protected from disclosure.  Should any of the requested documents be withheld, we will identify the reason for not disclosing them.

Maine Department of Administrative and Financial Services
https://www.maine.gov/dafs/

communications.subject: RE: Maine Freedom of Access Act Request: Maine State Employees (2018 - 2022)
communications.communication:
Hello:

The State of Maine does not maintain monthly electronic listings of all employees.

Attached is a report of all active employees of the Executive Branch as of January 11, 2023, which includes the information you have requested.

Additionally, an annual listing of employees, their respective agencies and salary/benefit information is available at https://www.maine.gov/osc/administration/data-share<https://gcc02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.maine.gov%2Fosc%2Fadministration%2Fdata-share&data=05%7C01%7CJennifer.Merrow%40maine.gov%7C4b5f4f6734a945b94cc908db0001a885%7C413fa8ab207d4b629bcdea1a8f2f864e%7C0%7C0%7C638103779339710936%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=S4kGmeTCPvbcu0k5Mb5Py2hb1bgqlW9%2BJNDc4ktavpw%3D&reserved=0> (for bulk download), as well as at https://opencheckbook.maine.gov/transparency/index.html<https://gcc02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fopencheckbook.maine.gov%2Ftransparency%2Findex.html&data=05%7C01%7CJennifer.Merrow%40maine.gov%7C4b5f4f6734a945b94cc908db0001a885%7C413fa8ab207d4b629bcdea1a8f2f864e%7C0%7C0%7C638103779339710936%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=vbwAaZXDtjZPLyhOknsDd2hi851oDf9tMnfCFcq35hc%3D&reserved=0>.

communications.subject: RE: Maine Freedom of Access Act Request: Maine State Employees (2018 - 2022)
communications.communication:
Thank you very much for passing along these data! I have a couple of, hopefully quick, questions. 

First, in the current file, the race column includes numbers rather than descriptions of each employee's race. Could you please include a crosswalk that shows which numbers correspond to which races? 

Second, is it possible to receive a historical copy of the current listing of employees? If so, could I request a copy from October 2020 (or around then)? 

Thank you very much for your time and assistance. 

Best,
Ben

I wanted to follow up on the following Maine Freedom of Access Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Nov. 24, 2022. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: Maine Freedom of Access Act Request: Maine State Employees
communications.communication:
Hello,

Regarding your request for a historical copy of the current listing of employees from October 2020, the Bureau of Human Resources does not have information responsive to your request.

A listing of which number corresponds to which race is provided below.

[cid:image001.png@01D9614E.A03E96A0]


Sincerely,
Maine Department of Administrative and Financial Services
https://www.maine.gov/dafs/

files.source: Department Of Administrative And Financial Services, Maine

title: Nathan Glazer refs

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Nathan Glazer refs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of file numbers:

* 62-46855
* 62-116659
* 75-238
* 100-151646
* 100-391697
* 100-445578
* 140-26813
* 161-9153

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

communications.subject: eFOIA Request Received
communications.communication:
# Individual Information

Prefix First Name Middle Name Last Name Suffix Email Phone Location

# Domestic Address

Address Line 1 Address Line 2 City State Postal

# Agreement to Pay

How you will pay

I am requesting a fee waiver for my request and have reviewed the FOIA
reference guide. If my fee waiver is denied, I would like to limit my request
to the two free hours of searching and 100 duplicated pages.

# Proof Of Affiliation for Fee Waiver

Waiver Explanation

    
    
    I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have
    previously
    written about the government and its activities, with some reaching over
    100,000
    readers in outlets such as Gizmodo, MuckRock, Motherboard, Property of the
    People,
    Unicorn Riot, and The Outline, among others. As such, as I have a reasonable
    expectation of publication and my editorial and writing skills are well
    established. In
    addition, I discuss and comment on the files online and make them available
    through
    non-profits such as the library Internet Archive and the journalist
    non-profit MuckRock,
    disseminating them to a large audience. While my research is not limited to
    this, a great
    deal of it, including this, focuses on the activities and attitudes of the
    government itself.
    As such, it is not necessary for me to demonstrate the relevance of this
    particular
    subject in advance.
    Further, case law states that “proof of the ability to disseminate the
    released information
    to a broad cross- section of the public is not required.” Judicial Watch,
    Inc. v. Dep’t of
    Justice, 365 F.3d 1108, 1126 (D.C. Cir. 2004); see Carney v. U.S. Dep’t of
    Justice, 19 F.
    3d 807, 814-15 (2d Cir. 1994). Further, courts have held that "qualified
    because it also
    had “firm” plans to “publish a number of . . . ‘document sets’” concerning
    United States
    foreign and national security policy." Under this criteria, as well, I
    qualify as a member of
    the news media.
    Additionally, courts have held that the news media status "focuses on the
    nature of the
    requester, not its request. The provision requires that the request be “made
    by” a
    representative of the news media. Id. § 552(a)(4)(A)(ii)(II). A newspaper
    reporter, for
    example, is a representative of the news media regardless of how much
    interest there is
    in the story for which he or she is requesting information." As such, the
    details of the
    request itself are moot for the purposes of determining the appropriate fee
    category.
    As my primary purpose is to inform about government activities by reporting
    on it and
    making the raw data available, I request that fees be waived.

Documentation Files

# Non-Individual FOIA Request

Request Information

    
    
    To Whom It May Concern:
    
    Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following
    records:
    
    Copies of file numbers:
    
    * 62-46855
    * 62-116659
    * 75-238
    * 100-151646
    * 100-391697
    * 100-445578
    * 140-26813
    * 161-9153
    
    The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
    this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
    
    In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me
    of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the
    request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM
    if not.
    
    Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look
    forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days,
    as the statute requires.
    
    Sincerely,
    
    Emma Best
    
    Attachments:
    
    
    https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/EmmaBest/74619/Fee20category20and20search20parameters.pdf
    Upload documents directly:
    https://https://www.muckrock.comhttps://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ffederal-bureau-of-investigation-10%252Fnathan-glazer-refs-79670%252F%253Femail%253Defoia%252540subscriptions.fbi.gov&url_auth_token=AAAj2ProGzquHYFeb-SMkiAXsEc%3A1i3Bwl%3AZsRaiZTHkmVOyzg668DpbKoiMn8

** 

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

title: New Mexico Commissary Price List- April 2023

communications.subject: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: New Mexico Commissary Price List- April 2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

*All current price list for commissary items and other products for inmate purchase within facilities under the jurisdiction of this agency.

Please provide materials for the following location and any other under the jurisdiction of this agency:
-Springer Correctional Center
-Western New Mexico Correctional Facility

If you have questions about this request, please call 239-778-7008

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Karen Fernandez-Rua

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: New Mexico Commissary Price List- April 2023 / IPRA 23-189
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Fernandez-Rua,

This is in response to your IPRA request no. 23-189 set forth below, dated April 9, 2023. The records custodian for the New Mexico Corrections Department (NMCD) has received your request and is in the process of reviewing it.

Pursuant to 14-2-8(D) of the IPRA, you will be provided with this agency’s response, including whether the Department has any objections (based on exemptions provided in the IPRA), within 15 days of receipt of your request, on or before April 24, 2023.

However, pursuant to 14-2-10 of the IPRA if the Department determines that your request is excessively burdensome or broad, you will be notified within the timeframe noted above and provided with an estimate of how much additional time will be needed to comply with your request.

Sincerely,

Leslie Garcia
Management Analyst
New Mexico Corrections Dept.
Office of General Counsel
P.O. Box 27116
Santa Fe, NM 87502-0116
(505) 827-8248 - office
(505) 629-2583 – cell
leslie.garcia1@cd.nm.gov<mailto:leslie.garcia1@cd.nm.gov>

NOTICE
The documents and message accompanying this transmission contain information that is from the Office of General Counsel, NM Corrections Dept. The information is intended only for use by the individual or entity to which this transmission has been addressed. If you are not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any disclosure, copying, distribution, action, or reliance upon the contents of the documents and message is strictly prohibited, and is intended solely for the use of the individual(s) or entity to whom it is addressed. If you are not the intended recipient or received these documents by mistake or error, please contact this office for instructions on its destruction or return.

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: New Mexico Commissary Price List- April 2023
communications.communication:
To whom it may concern:

I hope this message finds you well. I am reaching out to inquire about the status of my Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request that I submitted to your department on April 9th, 2023. While I understand that you may be dealing with a high volume of requests, I have not received any updates regarding the progress of my request and was hoping to obtain some information. I understand that you may be facing several challenges, and I kindly request your assistance in this matter.

I would be grateful if you could provide me with an update regarding my FOIA request when it is convenient for you. If there is anything further that I can do to assist in the process, please do not hesitate to let me know.

Thank you for your attention to this matter, and I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Warm regards,

Karen Fernandez-Rua

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: New Mexico Commissary Price List- April 2023 / IPRA 23-189
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Fernandez-Rua,

In response to your request below, information responsive to your request is available for inspection and is in the attached the PDF document.

The Department has responded to your request as it understands it, and it is now considered closed. Thank you.

Sincerely,


Leslie Garcia
Management Analyst
New Mexico Corrections Dept.
Office of General Counsel

title: Police Staff Roster (April 2023) (Lake Forest Police Park Department)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police Staff Roster (April 2023) (Lake Forest Police Park Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Staff roster including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: plain text with comma-separated-values (i.e., a "CSV" file), OpenDocument spreadsheet, Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record for me by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Automatic reply: [BULK] Washington Public Records Act Request: Police Staff Roster (April 2023) (Lake Forest Police Park Department)
communications.communication:
My last day with Lake Forest Park was Friday, November 5, 2021.
Please contact City Hall at (206) 368-5440 for assistance.

Thank you,

Jennifer Martin, CRM, CMC

communications.subject: Police Records Request
communications.communication:
April 18, 2023

Ms. Rose Terse
MuckRock News
DEPT MR 144394
263 Huntington Ave
Boston, MA 02115

Subject:  Public Records Request P23-119 received April 12, 2023

Dear Ms. Terse:

The City of Lake Forest Park received your public records request on April 12, 2023 for the following:


"Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Staff roster including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: plain text with comma-separated-values (i.e., a "CSV" file), OpenDocument spreadsheet, Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record for me by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse"

Please find attached the excel spreadsheet that is responsive to your request. With the release of this document, we consider this request completed, fulfilled and closed.

If we can be of further service, please contact our office Monday-Friday, 8am-4:30pm except legal holidays.

Respectfully,

Kelsey Altus
Records Specialist
